reviews.text: The Graf Moltke is conveniently located a short walk from the central station , so it is ideal if you are coming from the airport on the shuttle bus. This drops you off in front of the station and costs 8 euros return. It is quick and efficient. Similarly, the U bahn metro system outside the station can take you quickly and cheaply to all the tourist sites. The hotel itself is clean throughout, the reception staff were all very pleasant and the room we stayed in was adequate for our three night stay. We booked a larger type room (though it wasn't that large!) and this looked out onto an inner courtyard, so not much of a view but at least it was quiet. We did not go down for our breakfast as we were out quite late each night so cannot comment on this. (We walked into town and had a good brunch in the Karstad department store restaurant for a few euros).
reviews.title: Adequate hotel for short stay

reviews.text: All in all, however,we felt the room was overpriced at 110 euros per night. The area around the hotel is a red light district and apart from the working girls, there were some shady characters hanging about. Visitors need to be aware of this before considering any hotel in this vicinity. Do not let this put you off however. At no time did we feel threatened and we were often just coming in at 3.30 a.m. If you are looking for a clean, no frills hotel with a good location then you could do a lot worse than stay here, especially if you can get a cheaper deal than we did. It is an especially good location if you want to visit the St. Georg gay scene. The bars / clubs are all within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Central and average

reviews.text: I booked the Hotel for one night stay during July to connetct from my flight to the train the next morning.
reviews.title: Won't be staying there again

reviews.text: The room rate was under 60EU for a single incl private bath and breakfast.
reviews.title: Good value for money hotel
Exactly what it says on the tin!
reviews.text: Room was average single size with TV and view into court-yard.

booked hotel then read "red Alert "review of sept 2003 & wondered. Found red alert totally unfounded. Hotel was spotless, room fresh, clean ,comfortable. staff delightful & helpful Dining room a lovely room looking out on to a pleasant square ,good breakfast. Ideal for travelling as a few yards to main station, city tour bus, local trains. Good restuarants nearby. Don't miss day trip by train to World Heritage Lubeck
reviews.title: glad we weren't put off
The Ryanair bus drops you off outside
reviews.text: The Ryanair bus arrives into the main bus station in hamburg and directly opposite is the Graf Molkte hotel. We were given the largest room I've ever seen in any hotel. The room was on the corner of the hotel and was very much larger than others. The bed very low but comfortable. The bathroom very small but functional.

reviews.title: Red-light alert
reviews.text: Excellent choice at the self service breakfast.
